articles.title: Truist Flags Autonomous Driving Volatility Despite Higher Tesla (TSLA) Price Target
articles.mainIdea: Truist Flags Autonomous Driving Volatility Despite Higher Tesla (TSLA) Price Target
articles.summary: Insider Monkey: Truist Flags Autonomous Driving Volatility Despite Higher Tesla (TSLA) Price Target. Tesla, Inc. (NASDAQ:TSLA) is one of the AI Stocks in the Spotlight for Investors. On December 19, Truist Securities raised its price target on the stock to $444.00 from $406.00 while maintaining a “Hold” rating. The firm believes that autonomous driving developments will lead to continued volatility in the stock despite long-term AI vision. A large […] Related tickers mentioned: TFC.

articles.title: Analysis-Global investors turn to Chinese AI as Wall Street fears bubble
articles.mainIdea: Analysis-Global investors turn to Chinese AI as Wall Street fears bubble
articles.summary: Reuters: Analysis-Global investors turn to Chinese AI as Wall Street fears bubble. Foreigners see China closing ‌the tech gap with the U.S. as Beijing steps up support for AI chipmakers, spurring bets on Chinese companies just as worries grow over lofty valuations on U.S.-listed AI stocks. U.K.-based asset manager Ruffer, for example, said it has "deliberately limited ‌exposure" to the Magnificent Seven - the U.S. tech giants - and is looking to add positions in Alibaba for a bigger exposure to China's AI theme. "While the U.S. remains the leader in frontier AI, China is rapidly narrowing the gap," said Gemma Cairns-Smith, Investment Specialist at Ruffer. Related tickers mentioned: 0981.HK, 5310.TWO, 688008.SS, 688256.SS, 688795.SS, AAPL, AMD, BABA, BIDU, GOOG, META, NVDA, OPAI.PVT, TCEHY, ^IXIC.

articles.title: Musk Could Pay The $1,000 'Trump Account' Bonus For Every Baby Born In The Next 4 Years And Keep 98% Of His Fortune
articles.mainIdea: Musk Could Pay The $1,000 'Trump Account' Bonus For Every Baby Born In The Next 4 Years And Keep 98% Of His Fortune
articles.summary: Benzinga: Musk Could Pay The $1,000 'Trump Account' Bonus For Every Baby Born In The Next 4 Years And Keep 98% Of His Fortune. A plan by President Donald Trump to launch Trump accounts for children born from 2025 through 2028 with $1,000 from the government has drawn support from Americans and also from billionaires, helping to fund them. However, the world's richest man has taken the opposite stance; Elon Musk is not only refusing to donate but is actively urging other wealthy individuals to withhold their support. Here's a look at how easily Musk could underwrite the entire initiative if he chose to. Trump Accounts Ge
